attributes.action: Make sensory rooms compulsory in schools and provide separate funding for it.
attributes.background: CAMHS is in a serious and worsening crisis and it is failing our children.   The first step to helping our children would be to equip our schools with sensory rooms.  This will be the foundation block for children with specialist learning needs, including autism and learning disabilities
attributes.additional_details:
Sensory rooms in schools will benefit our children hugely.  Please give your full support
https://www.experia-innovations.co.uk/blog/the-benefits-of-a-sensory-room/   
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/health/nhs-mental-health-services-children-turn-away-day-vulnerable-nspcc-study-a8047401.html
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/oct/24/mental-health-children-camhs-jeremy-hunt-nhs-tragedies-funding-cuts
What is a sensory room
https://www.green-modular.com/blog/sensory-rooms-schools/

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for all NHS staff
attributes.background: NHS staff are dedicated and commited to providing excellent healthcare for all people, however on the low wages they receive it seems only fair that they can take care of themselves too as a thank you.

attributes.action: Allow the possession of a registered pepper spray as a self-defence weapon
attributes.background: In face of looming and spiralling out of control knife and noxious substances, the law abiding citizens and residents have literally no means to protect themselves from thugs, muggings, random knife attacks, gun point attacks, rape and more serious GBHs. We're asking HM government to act now!
attributes.additional_details: In face of looming and spiralling out of control knife and noxious substances, the law abiding citizens and residents have literally no means to protect themselves from thugs, muggings, random knife attacks, gun point attacks, rape and more serious GBHs. We're asking HM government to follow the example of other EU countries such as  Austria, Czech, Denmark, Finland ( en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pepper_spray) and allow the possession of a registered pepper spray as a self defence weapon.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for hgv drivers
attributes.background: I’ve been an hgv driver for 9 years and have been on the same wage with no increase, yet minimum wage keeps getting close to a skilled hgv drivers wage. The average hgv driver age is 56 and the country is short of drivers as it is (60,000)
attributes.additional_details: So in 10 years time the numbers will be far greater, so act now and increase the wage to reflect the work we do on a daily basis and encourage the younger generation to take up a career in driving, because as it stands now I wouldn’t recommend it to

attributes.action: Reduce corporation tax to 15% when the UK leaves the EU to attract investment
attributes.background:
Once we leave the EU, the UK should reduce corporation tax to 15% This would do the following: 
-Attract new investment from multinational companies 
-Will stop companies leaving the UK due to Brexit 
-Allows companies to invest more money back into the country
-Reduce the unemployment rate

attributes.action: Cap life insurance premiums for applicants with Mental Health problems.
attributes.background: I was medically discharged from the Armed Forces in 2016 and with this dramatic change in my life I suffered with depression and an adjustment disorder, a problem I still suffer with.  After a battle with myself I finally built up the courage to get the help I needed, but It has now taken me 2 years
attributes.additional_details: to find a company that will actually give me life insurance and within this search was point blank refused cover by multiple insurers.   After allowing an insurer to obtain a targeted medical report from my GP they have offered to cover me, but I was shocked that there was around a 200% premium increase compared to that of my wife’s. The added financial burdens will not only deter people from getting help but will also add more pressure to those affected and may hinder recovery.

attributes.action: Ban Helium in party balloons.
attributes.background: Helium is used to inflate party balloons. We believe that helium, as a finite resource, should be used exclusively for essential needs such as medial purposes. Party balloons can be used with air to create great displays. Parts of Norway have banned helium for balloons and the UK should follow.
attributes.additional_details:
Norway helium ban
https://www.plasticsoupfoundation.org/en/2018/05/norway-bans-helium-balloons/

Alternative ways to display balloons without using helium
https://www.getpersonalised.net/personalised-balloons/displaying-number-balloons-with-air-lets-stop-the-helium/

attributes.action: Introduce impact of humans/plastic on the environment to the primary curriculum.
attributes.background: The effect we as a species have on the environment, especially when discussing plastic, is extremely important and may have considerable consequences on the lives of today's children. Educating them will help them understand how to help and protect the environment and their future.
attributes.additional_details: The response from people of all ages after watching David Attenborough's Blue Planet II was overwhelming - people want to change the way we use plastic. However children of a primary school age do not necessarily have access to the information provided by the series. Educating all children across the country allows them to make their own judgements on what is right or wrong for the future of plastics and inform them for when they're old enough to vote on such matters.

attributes.action: Sex crimes against children to receive harsher penalties and mandatory jail time
attributes.background: Paedophiles who arrange to meet children, help facilitate attacks over the internet, download child pornography or sexually abuse children are often getting very little if at all any jail time; this is not a deterrent to those who seek out our children for their own twisted needs.
attributes.additional_details:
More details
It's about time paedophiles are scared of the sentences given at court to deter them from their crimes. No crime is victimless; children are abused so others can download the pictures therefore facilitating this crime. Parents and non parents are outraged when a shoplifter can get a heavier sentence than those who destroy the souls of our children and it's about time that stopped

attributes.action: Water safety & effects of cold water to be taught to teenagers
attributes.background: In 2018 we have seen a increase in the amount of deaths in water from cold water shock and drowning, This increase is due to the hot weather we have had. This makes it more worrying that none really trains members of the community or school children on the dangers of open water and how to stay safe.
attributes.additional_details:
We really need to train youngsters and adults in the dangers of cold water shock, this can be triggered by jumping into the water which holds its temperature between 10 degrees - 15 degrees, 

The biggest danger is inhaling water and drowning, even if the water is flat, calm and you know how to swim. Cold Water Shock causes an immediate loss of breathing control. You take one or more huge gasps, followed by hyperventilation – very rapid breathing that is hard or impossible for you to control.

attributes.action: Legalise assisted dying for terminal illnesses.
attributes.background: It's wrong that doctors have to keep alive people who are in either serious physical or mental distress when they wish to end their own lives.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone should be able to do whatever they want with their own lives. We're all supposed to live in a country where we supposedly have pure freedom. People can't end their lives if their life is a horror every day.

attributes.action: Regulate prescription fees from all UK veterinary surgeons.
attributes.background: Unregulated, vets can now charge what they like for writing prescriptions. A £5.00 standard charge should be made law to enable already over charged clients to purchase medications elsewhere such as a Animal chemist for often up to 800% cheaper than buying from a vet.
attributes.additional_details: Above information is easily checked by anyone having an invoice from their vet for medications and comparing same items on price with various animal chemists that are found on line.

attributes.action: Make online retailers disclose the courier company that they use on website
attributes.background: With a varying degree of service provided by differing courier companies and not knowing which company will be (or not) delivering your goods, it should be compulsory for all online retailers to disclose which company they are using, prior to checkout on the website.
attributes.additional_details: Knowing which courier company has been engaged stops the lottery of will they or won't they deliver. In rural areas we know which companies are reliable and which ones don't bother at all, however, when we order we are then subject to the lottery of will goods turn up or not. This will ensure that we can have an informed choice as to whether to proceed with the purchase or not before committing to it.

attributes.action: Illegal for children under the age of 16 to purchase eggs
attributes.background: Following the recent devastating incidents and criminal damage that has been caused not only in my area but around the country with children throwing eggs at cars, houses and shops has created a big upset.
attributes.additional_details: A young boy has been left critically injured, after a group of children had thrown an egg, from the opposite side of the road, at a cars front windscreen which led the driver to not be able to see where they were going and innocently hitting a young boy, who was trick or treating with his friends, this has left him with a bleed to his brain and not knowing who his mum and other family members were. Just imagine the upset that the family is going through. I pray that Brendan has a speedy recovery

attributes.action: Abolish faith schools
attributes.background: Children under no circumstance should be submitted to education in religious schools. We should encourage future generations to have an academic mindset free from religious belief.
attributes.additional_details: Religion is a choice that should be made in adulthood and not influenced and preached onto young growing minds.

attributes.action: Abolish fines for parents requesting absence from school.
attributes.background: My mum wanted to take my three little sisters on holiday abroad. She nor my sisters have seen my grandmother in nine years, and now that have finally been able to save up to go during Christmas time, they risk being fined £60 per child per leave of absence.
attributes.additional_details: All of my sisters have excellent attendance, why should my mum have to pay over £900 pounds for missing five days of school?

attributes.action: Ban religious studies in schools
attributes.background: Religion does not belong in the school system. I do not send my child to school to learn about religion - that is what church is for.

attributes.action: Criminal Record checks on drivers of taxis and private hire a legal requirement.
attributes.background: Currently no legal requirement only recommendations. There should be mandatory checks in place as a minimum requirement. Licences should be removed from those found to have violent or sexual convictions. We have a duty to protect women, children and the vulnerable and less able.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers of taxis and private hire vehicles are currently allowed to keep their licences and continue to work even if they have criminal convictions.

attributes.action: Help end the scarcity of landlords who will accept the housing element of UC.
attributes.background: Removing a tenant's choice to have housing benefit paid directly to a landlord has meant that few landlords are prepared to house claimants. I fear this will continue (within UC) to contribute to homelessness for many and cause a number of deaths via exposure this winter.
attributes.additional_details: I completely understand the ethos behind encouraging those receiving benefits to take increasing levels of financial responsibility and to work towards independent living. However, the increased uncertainty for landlords caused by the freeze on LHA rates, and the strong preference towards the allowance being paid to the claimant, disadvantages vulnerable adults and leaves many trapped in addiction and homelessness. https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN07008

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for Supermarkets to give all leftover produce to homeless
attributes.background: The amount of food waste by Supermarket’s in the UK stands at 1.9 million tonnes and that is simply sickening when there are 8 million people living in food poverty today.

attributes.action: Should be a pets NHS. Not every1 can afford their pets ops and treatments
attributes.background: If you can't afford your pets operations or treatments they end up getting put down and its not fair. If your from a working class family it can be hard providing for your family as well as paying huge vet bills. Pets are part of the family!:)xxx
attributes.additional_details: please sign

attributes.action: Routinely arm all UK Police Officers.
attributes.background:
The British Police face numerous threats including terrorists, robbers, drug dealers, in addition to the growing numbers teenagers who now regularly carry knives.

These individuals have no fear, do not value life and would not think twice about shooting or stabbing an unarmed Police Officer.

attributes.action: School should start at 10am as teenagers are too tired
attributes.background: Teenagers are so tired due to having to wake up very early to get to school. The Government should require secondary schools to start later, which will lead to increased productivity at school.

attributes.action: Human trafficking Sex slavery: anyone found guilty receives a life sentence
attributes.background: Sex slavery one of the many forms of slavery, under the banner Human Trafficking. An estimated 4.8 million (mainly) women and children are sex slaves worldwide. They are stolen, locked up, beaten, can't leave the home , forced out as prostitutes and raped by up to 200 men a day.
attributes.additional_details: The lives of these innocent people are stolen, and if they survive they are damaged for life. The same as murder. I've read cases where the abuser has had lots of women locked up and raped all day long , even children. When he is found guilty he might only get 2 years in jail while these innocent people are destroyed. If this evil becomes a guaranteed life sentence it will decrease the numbers of victims. Any other punishment for such evil is too low. Please see: Hope for Justice, and Love for Justice international.

attributes.action: Repeal Welfare Reform Act 2012 and ban outright zero hours contracts
attributes.background: The Welfare Reform Act 2012 and zero hours contracts are causing huge levels of social deprivation and poverty impacting significantly on disabled and vulnerable people which must be stopped.

attributes.action: Allow Tattoos for 16 year olds with parental consent
attributes.background: Allow special tattoos for 16 year olds in meanings of birth, death and engagements e.g. 16.04.10 and scan photo or 16.04.10 to 28.02.64 and picture portrait.
attributes.additional_details: Allow memorable tattoos for 16 year olds.

attributes.action: Introduce official national ID cards or make PASS cards part of the law
attributes.background: Many people lose their IDs such as driving license which is difficult and costly to replace.PASS hologram cards supposedly should fix this problem but until this day not every place recognises this type of identification.We need the government to introduce something that would be recognisable fully
attributes.additional_details: PASS hologram cards don’t work everywhere from my experience as many places like nightclubs are not even aware of them and usually they reject people that have them. What is the point for the government to support a scheme that is not effective. We need a government issued national ID or make PASS hologram cards part of official identification here in England in order to solve this problem as carrying driving licences or passports is a big risk to take and a long process to replace

attributes.action: Invite Polish Armed Forces to take a part in all future Remembrance Day Parades
attributes.background: During the war, more than 200,000 members of the Polish Armed Forces in the West had fought under British High Command. The British government did not specifically invite representatives of the Polish forces that had fought under British High Command for the London Victory Celebrations of 1946
attributes.additional_details: There is no significant effort being put in acknowledging and recognition, all the effort, sacrifice of service men and women who fought in WWII under B.H.C. These people are almost gone and are still feeling betrayed and forgotten, unappreciated. It's one of the last chances for the British Government to change the mistake of the historical decisions and make it good for the future and for the post Brexit relations between Poles living in the UK and Britons.

attributes.action: Make selling a new house without building regulation sign-off illegal.
attributes.background: New build houses are being sold without a buildings regulation approval certificate being handed over on completion. Make selling a new build house that has not been signed off by building control illegal and a prosecutable offence.

attributes.action: Make repeat offenders pay a percentage for emergency service costs
attributes.background:
Persons who are being repeatdly arrested for offending for: affray, public disturbance, ABH or GBH should pay a percentage of the emergency service costs which attended the scene.
Court costs recover some expenses but not all. A levy should be applied in these cases.
attributes.additional_details:
This method would help as a deterrent to knife attacks/gang crime, and it would also make it fair for persons who do not cause undue expenses from the emergency services.
Crime is on the rise and there are more gangs than ever.
This levy could also be expanded to moped theft gangs for the expense of a vehicle/foot pursuit.
Some persons cannot afford fines, but in that case then this would also help a legal case to get the dangerous repeat offenders locked up.

attributes.action: Tax Break for citizens who are renting and do not own a home
attributes.background: Government should give tax-breaks to those who are renting. Foreign investment in housing has allowed companies to make housing their business by buying/selling & renting out. This causes house prices and rents to continuously soar and has already made homes unaffordable to middle-class citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Whenever new flats are built some percentage of it goes to council. Then a huge percentage are bought by foreign/local companies. Then whatever flats are left, some of them are bought by people who already have homes. This puts a huge pressure on supply and greatly increases the supply-demand gap that triggers house prices shoot up. Home is a basic necessity as food & water, and therefore it cannot be allowed to become a business. If Government is not doing enough, then people should be compensated.

attributes.action: Increase nhs staff awareness and training on the signs and symptoms of sepsis
attributes.background:
I have since heard of many other cases of children with sepsis being misdiagnosed having gastroenteritis, sometimes with long term effects. 
I want government to look at this issue and increase training awareness within the nhs to prevent more unnecessary child deaths or life changing effects.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son, had severe leg pain, a very high temperature, vomiting and neck stiffness. We called 111 who sent us an ambulance to a and e. When we arrived, were seen by the doctor, he took a brief look over our son and asked of his symptoms. We said the symptoms, then he concluded that it could be gastroenteritis. He said we could take him home if he could keep some food down, which he did. However I said I was very concerned as he could not sit up unaided at this point and I would like another opinion. The paedeatrician came and immediately suggested meningitis and sepsis. He took bloods immediately and put our son onto strong antibiotics (this saved his life). The bloods later came back as positive for meningococcal septaceamia. 
Without fast treatment for Sepsis, it can be fatal.

attributes.action: Make laws to prevent the fitting of excessively noisy exhausts to motor bikes
attributes.background: There are an increasing number of motorbikes and cars with exhausts that can be heard through double glazing and from over a quarter of a mile away. They disturb sleep, prevent conversation and cause stress. Their only purpose is to draw attention to the vehicle
attributes.additional_details:
A number of motorbikes and some cars frequently disturb me, often during the night or very early morning. Most people with whom I discuss this have also been disturbed.
One motorcyclist wakes me any time between 5:30 and 6:30am. He starts from his home, which I haven't yet identified, pushing his bike, and starts it up outside my house. He clearly knows it is too loud and avoids disturbing his own family.
The Chief Medical Officer has expressed concern about air and noise pollution.

attributes.action: Stop under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified
attributes.background: Stop all under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified at 18 same as gambling sites to eliminate child grooming and paedophile activity
attributes.additional_details: Girls are adding random guys all over the world and sending illicit photos of themselves and sexting my daughter was 1 of these at the age of 16 I have now took all media off her including her phone but I would like it stopped nationally as it's unsafe for any child

attributes.action: Redefine the term ‘majority’ in regards to referendums as a minimum of 65%.
attributes.background: 52% is NOT  majority; this means that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. The government needs to redefine the term 'majority' in a referendum to 65% minimum.
attributes.additional_details:
In other countries, such as the US, a major change to the constitution requires two-thirds majority in both the Senate and House of Representatives. The fact that in the UK a result of just over 50% can constitute a major change can and has led to major social divisions within the country whilst also meaning that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. This makes the country vulnerable to disinformation.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36306681

attributes.action: A cycle path should be provided by law when roads are  redeveloped or created
attributes.background: housing estates on east way in Preston lancashire have been built and accompanying pavements but no cyclepaths have been created.

attributes.action: Remove anonymity from MPs accused of misconduct.
attributes.background: MPs have voted to grant themselves anonymity if accused of sexual harassment or expenses misconduct. They will remain anonymous while being investigated – and might not be named even if they are judged guilty.
attributes.additional_details: MPs should not have rights above those of ordinary people. Otherwise, even if they get caught, we may never know.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for pedestrians to cross a road where a crossing is visible.
attributes.background: Too many RTA occur on the roads of England, with a majority of these being due to pedestrians crossing a road where a pedestrian crossing is accessible for them to use. Drivers are punished for stupidity of pedestrians! It’s illegal in the USA and I feel it should be here where a crossing is visible

attributes.action: Keep Beechen Cliff as a state school as supported by parents and pupils
attributes.background:
The government are querying whether to close Beechen Cliff school in Bath due to a recent Ofsted report. This report was a shock to pupils, teachers and parents and in no way reflects the school.
Please sign this petition to stop the government withdrawing funding and closing the school

attributes.action: No more than 1 junction or 5 miles of roadworks, on a motorway or  A road
attributes.background:
This causes a lot of congestion and stand still traffic, there is more likely to be a road traffic incident in roadworks. 
Most of the time road works are only been worked on in a 1 mile stretch, there is no need for so many miles to be closed for years and years
attributes.additional_details:
M6- over 20 miles of motorway 2 miles of workers max, incidents at least 1 aday, 
M5 1 junction 2-3,bridge repairs hardly any incidents and not as much congestion

attributes.action: Stop the ban of menthol cigarettes when the UK leaves the EU
attributes.background: A cigarette is a cigarette menthol or not, it's just a preference as is coke with vodka. In 2020 menthol cigarettes were to be banned under new EU laws but the UK is preparing to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst on the topic binge drinking seems to be a regular thing and alcohol also takes/ruins many lives but I don't see any graphic images or warnings on alcohol. End the menthol and flavoured tobacco ban in 2020 since the UK is leaving the EU.

attributes.action: The government should require all rail companies to offer part season tickets.
attributes.background: Rail prices continually increase year on year out of line with wage increases. Those working part time are forced to make a choice between accepting sky high day fares or buying season tickets which do not offer good value for money. Women and carers are disproportionately affected.

attributes.action: Give apt psychological & CBT therapy on NHS to struggling with Asperger Syndrome
attributes.background: People with Asperger Syndrome and other conditions are being denied 1 to 1 appropriate Psychological & Cognitive Behaviour Therapy, even though they may have other conditions e.g. mental health problems. This has a serious impact and prevents them from leading a full balanced life.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS does not currently offer 1 to 1 talking therapies to those with Asperger Syndrome, irrespective of other mental health issues. The Government and NICE to ensure that those in need, requiring such appropriate talking therapies are treated equally to those requiring an operation. The requirement to be deemed as appropriate by the patient and/or a Health Professional/Clinician and/or Social Workers. Those with Asperger Syndrome when needed, be able to access it in a timely manner, as part of an ‘Overall HOLISTICAL approach’ for as long as it is required to work through direct and associated issues, to a measurable outcome & life balance.

attributes.action: Force UK rail firms to offer Mon-Friday season tickets, to reduce ticket costs.
attributes.background: Weekly/Monthly/Yearly rail season ticket prices are expensive and inflexible, with season ticket pricing including weekend travel. Weekend travel isn't essential for all. We ask that the government force rail firms to offer season tickets which exclude weekends and reducing the prices for them.
attributes.additional_details: The RPI formula means rail ticket prices regularly go up faster than UK wage growth. The year-on-year increase in rail ticket prices is also outstripping many nations in the EU, making rail travel in the UK some of the most expensive in Europe. Unreliability and overcrowding aside, allowing customers to exclude weekend travel could pass on savings, whilst creating fairness and flexibility to customers too.

attributes.action: Ban plastic wrappers for individually sold greetings cards.
attributes.background:
Reducing single use plastic should be priority for all of us. 

This petition is over the use of plastic wrapping for individually sold greeings cards. 

Greetings card and envelopes are already sold without the need for plastic wrapping in a number of shops. This should be made mandatory.

attributes.action: Give women 2 paid days off a month when needed during their time of the month.
attributes.background: Menstruation is bleeding that occurs when the uterus sheds its lining. Periods usually last from 2-7 days and can be light/heavy. Along with that women experience other symptoms such as back, neck and headaches, nausea, and diarrhea. Most women have to endure this whilst working and it's not right.
attributes.additional_details: Additionally more symptoms are migraines, stomachaches, and vomiting. Up to 20% of women experience extreme cramps at the onset of a period – a condition called dysmenorrhea. These cramps cause immense discomfort and pain, experiencing this at work affects productivity. Many women don't take sick days as it's something they know will come and simply cannot avoid unlike viral or bacterial illnesses almost all people experience. Other countries have adopted this and the UK should rightly follow suit.

attributes.action: Ban websites supporting and promoting eating disorders, suicide and self harm
attributes.background:
The internet these days are widely accessed by all ages. This allows vulnerable and young people to access harmful content promoting and sharing ideas towards eating disorders, self harm and suicide. 
We would like the government to impose a ban on accessing such sites in the UK
attributes.additional_details: https://www.healthyplace.com/abuse/self-injury/why-pro-self-injury-pro-self-harm-websites-are-dangerous

attributes.action: Have a referendum allowing all the UK a vote on Scotland’s Independence.
attributes.background: In 2014 Scotland had an independence vote on whether to remain in the UK or become an independent country.  The rest of the UK did not get to vote on if we wanted Scotland to remain.  Allow all UK citizens, including the Scottish to debate and vote on Scotland’s continued membership in the UK.

attributes.action: Make school days start at 9:30 and end at 4:30
attributes.background: Research supports that brains function better when your not tired and you’ve had enough sleep, getting to school jus one hour later would make a huge difference to how focused students are at school

attributes.action: Review the use of Palm Oil in products consumed in the UK and it’s taxation.
attributes.background: Palm oil is widely used in everyday products, I believe more can be done to protect areas destroyed for palm oil plantations. I am requesting to UK to set the trend of reviewing the use and availability of palm oil including its taxation.
